results.title: Botanic man. - Volume 1: Episodes 1-4.
results.creator_credit: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International
results.brief_description: A compilation of David Bellamy’s “Greenprint for life”, “The Crucible of life”, “Living Water”, and “Potential energy”. Contents include Amazon rain forest ecology, the emergence of the earliest life forms, marine ecology and the Peruvian trench, the evolutionary transition from sea to land and its legacy of peat and coal deposits.

results.title: Boston Symphony Orchestra
results.brief_description: The Boston Symphony Orchestra in Japan in 1960, conducted by Charles Munch and Aaron Copland, includes performances of sections of major works with narration kept to a minimum. Includes complete movements or sections from the following: Easley Blackwood Jnr - “Symphony No. 1”; Hector Berlioz - “Symphony Fantastique”; Aaron Copland - “The Tender Land”; Claude Debussy - Symphonic Poem “La Mer”.

results.title: Borrowed faces
results.brief_description: Covers the audition process at the 1979 Colorado Shakespeare Festival from the viewpoints of the actors and directors. The actors’ feelings about acting, about themselves and the roles they play are examined, as well as how they handle rejections; the directors talk about how they decide which actors to cast in which roles. The final scene shows the successful actors playing the roles for which they auditioned.

results.creator_credit: Derek Hart, Tony Snowdon and Associated Television

results.title: Born spastic
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board and Spastic Society
results.brief_description: Unambiguously, the film explains cerebral palsy and shows various activities of handicapped people in England, including sheltered workshops and social clubs, like Joe’s Club, which caters not only for the handicapped, but their siblings as well. Both the handicapped and the people involved with them discuss some of the problems faced by the handicapped in England.

results.title: Boring for water in South Africa
results.brief_description: An instructional film showing procedures in drilling water bores in arid areas of South Africa, from the geological survey to the setting up and operation of the drill rig. Includes drill-bit sharpening, operation and erection of a windmill to pump out water.

results.title: Boomtown
results.brief_description: An animation in which satirist Jules Feiffer makes a pungent comment on the US arms race and military build-up. Text by Jules Feiffer, animation by Bill Plympton.

results.title: Books and people: the wealth within
results.brief_description: States that education is a continuing process which does not end when school studies are completed. The ways in which the modern public library serves this purpose and meets practical needs in the community are illustrated. The film describes how the Alabama library extension agency operates and how it helps local communities in establishing and strengthening county libraries. Various forms of library services designed to meet special needs in the community are described. These include the use of bookmobiles to bring books, recorded music, and films to outlying rural communities.

results.title: Booked for safekeeping
results.creator_credit: George C. Stoney and Stoney Associates
results.brief_description: Demonstrates management of mentally ill people who become the responsibility of the police. Discusses treatment on reception, emphasising the need for immediate attention. Shows how to cope with violent or potentially violent patients and stresses the importance of treatment in the first few hours, and discusses the need for medical assistance in gaols.
